Description: Small pendant made of faience in the shape of a cornflower. The base is flat, the upper side is textured. The body is in a beige colour now, except for the blossom leaves in dark blue glaze. The lug at the base is still partly visible, the one at the top is completely broken off. The pendant is broken into two pieces.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
